relation: Great for these types of students
Great for people who want diversity and a small school environment.
Well, it's in LA so just a bus ride or a 15 minute drive away, there is plenty of activity to jump in to and enjoy.
The school has stores for snacks but no actual place to serve food, but there are plenty of places really close by to go and eat.
There is none, it is a community college without dorms.
The teachers know you, so it pushes you to try harder since you don't get lost in the midst of a giant classroom.

Make sure to register early and to stay on top of scheduling because classes get full quick, which I'm sure is an issue everywhere. Also do research on all the resources and programs ELAC has to offer because it can really help, and get involved as much as possible.

I have had the privilege to attend this college. Despite it being small, the people who work there really try to bring in as many opportunities as possible to ensure a successful college experience. The school has a very welcoming vibe, and it's diverse.
pageTitle: East Los Angeles College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {352698=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 274375=I haven't yet attended the school since I start at the end of August but I can see there is a bunch of entertainment not only on the campus but around the area. I've already fallen in love with a local restaurant designed for college students. It has a variety of Chinese food and has a bunch of fun games like air hockey, table tennis. A bunch of arcade games, and more fun stuff. However on campus there ialways events from the many clubs on campus like the drama club who are always whipping up lovely plays., 291309=The campus will have a cafeteria in 2016 and now the students can all enjoy the various food locations around campus, the lunch truck, and food from the Husky Store., 172318=Home of the 1984 Olympics., 324451=In november there is Aztec dancers that perform in ELAC. Also they have the Aztlan 5k run and the 3k walk., 324741=jogging in the neigborhood, visit the vincent museum. participate in the Aztlan run or walk in August.}

textAfterTable: look at all your options to get help, there are many out there. In three sentences elac goes out of their way to help students succeed. it is extremely diverse. Login to rate or flag the reviews Susana from South Gate, CA 03/09/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 3 of 87 Categories Comments Campus Safety the campus safety is not that great. the cadets are only there for their own interest. they are usually flirting and not doing their job. Greek Life no greek life for this is a community college. Clubs and Activities there are many clubs around the campus and the best part is that its very easy to start your own club. Great for these types of students this college is great for those
